data.title: New task runner does not show multiple tasks from old configuration
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (afe47dc84467b487ce0079ff72f55e7ef4f7ebca, 2017-05-30T10:34:18.253Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Testing #27471

The old task runner offers the two tasks `hello` and `bye` to choose from, the new task runner only shows the `echo` task:
```
{
  "version": "2.0.0",
  "command": "echo",
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "args": [],
  "showOutput": "always",
  "echoCommand": true,
  "suppressTaskName": true,
  "tasks": [
    {
      "taskName": "hello",
      "args": [
        "Hello World"
      ]
    },
    {
      "taskName": "bye",
      "args": [
        "Good Bye"
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

data.title: "showOutput": "silent" not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (afe47dc84467b487ce0079ff72f55e7ef4f7ebca, 2017-05-30T10:34:18.253Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: none
---

Testing #27471

https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks says `"silent"` should reveal if there are no output matchers. This doesn't reveal for me:
```
{
  "version": "2.0.0",
  "command": "echo",
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "args": [
    "Hello World"
  ],
  "showOutput": "silent"
}
```

Same with `"terminal": { "reveal": "silent" }`, so maybe this simply has changed, although I can't find a difference between `"silent"` and `"never"`.

- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-21-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.3.0|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.2.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.1|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;


---

#27316

Currently we have `emmet.triggerExpansionOnTab` to disable emmet. With `emmet.useModules` it pops up intellisense could be quite intrusive if people decide they don't want to use emmet.

data.title: Show info box for keybindings if it uses keycode
data.body:
Ref https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27481

Right now when use non-US keyboard layout, we use keycode to represent what users really press and users have a good understanding of what key he/she should press as we have a good hint box 

![screen shot 2017-05-30 at 11 28 10 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/26598794/38acd2b2-452b-11e7-8640-264e210effe8.png)

But after we switch to standard US layout, the hint is gone. Maybe we can keep providing this kind of info as above
![screen shot 2017-05-30 at 11 27 52 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/26598843/59b072b6-452b-11e7-9849-ca7b478cb358.png)

2. Open a html file
3. Type `.foo`
4. Press tab
5. Press ctrl+z
6. Press tab, notice the tab is not added, instead a cursor appears to get removed
7. Press tab, now the tab is added

data.title: Hide keybinding in cmd pallet when the when clause doesnt apply
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (c2a17a7929259d3d2643cb3f98478e994a39605b, 2017-05-30T05:12:15.312Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-21-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.3.0|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.2.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.1|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;


---

#27316

The command palette says tab:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26598439/187158b6-452a-11e7-979e-772f64c10935.png)

But pressing tab in this state does nothing:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26598473/31696d22-452a-11e7-962b-05c9f33e60c0.png)

keybindings.json entry:

```js
{ "key": "tab",                   "command": "editor.emmet.action.expandAbbreviation",
                                     "when": "config.emmet.triggerExpansionOnTab && editorTextFocus && !config.emmet.useModules && !editorHasMultipleSelections && !editorHasSelection && !editorReadonly && !editorTabMovesFocus" },
```

Maybe it's an issue with the keybindings system? Why is it saying tab in the command palette when the context is wrong (`emmet.useModules` is true)

data.title: emmet.useModules setting is a little confusing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (c2a17a7929259d3d2643cb3f98478e994a39605b, 2017-05-30T05:12:15.312Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-21-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.3.0|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.2.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.1|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;


---

#27316

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26597882/566bdd28-4528-11e7-8117-ca78be658fee.png)

Some comments:

- `useModules` doesn't say to me this is the latest and greatest version, why not something like `emmet.useVersion2`, `emmet.useExperimentalVersion`, `emmet.useLatest`, etc.
- The wording also needs some work ("than" should be "instead of"), how about something like this?

  > Use the new experimental emmet features based on emmet v2.0.

  or

  > Enable the use of emmet modules, replacing the old single emmet library (this will eventually become the default).

data.title: When launching settings, the search is focused instead of json file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (c2a17a7929259d3d2643cb3f98478e994a39605b, 2017-05-30T05:12:15.312Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-21-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|lorem-ipsum|Tyriar|1.0.0|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.3.0|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.2.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.1|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|git-project-manager|felipecaputo|1.3.2|
|md-navigate|jrieken|0.0.1|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.2|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|;


---

This seems to make it much more difficult to change settings and really interrupts my flow personally. Before I would do the following:

1. ctrl+,
2. ctrl+end
3. Add a new setting

Now I need to:

1. ctrl+,
1. tab
1. tab
1. tab
1. tab
1. tab
1. tab
1. ctrl+end
1. Add the setting

I notice there is `workbench.settings.openDefaultSettings` which kind of works around the issue, but I like the defaults there to still search for reference so I would not want to use this setting.

data.title: Change the MP queries to supported API
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: All

The MP team has notified me that there is a better way to use the API for searching for categories and tags. They designed the website to handle `category:<category name>` but intended clients to use a filter. 

Here are the changes they recommend we make. 

| Current Usage | Current Filter Usage | Recommended Filter Usage |
| -------------- | -------------------- | ------------------------ |
| category:themes | search filter with value `category:themes` | category filter with value `themes` | 
| tag:icon-theme | search filter with value `tag:icon-theme` | tag filter with value `icon-theme` | 
| tag: debuggers | search filter with value `tag:debuggers` | tag filter with value `debuggers` | 
| category:scm providers | search filter with value `category:scm providers` | category filter with value `scm providers` |
| category:keymaps | search filter with value `category:keymaps` | category filter with value `keymaps` |

Different filter types:
- InstallationTarget: 8
- Tag: 1
- Category: 5
- SearchText: 10

data.title: Automated smoke test terminal test fails when using a multi-line $PS1
data.body:
#27456 

OS: Linux
Command: `npm test -- --latest /usr/share/code-insiders/bin/code-insiders --stable /usr/share/code/bin/code`

```
    Integrated Terminal

      2) opens terminal, runs 'echo' and verifies the output

...

  2) Smoke Test Suite Integrated Terminal opens terminal, runs 'echo' and verifies the output:

      AssertionError: '~/dev/Microsoft/vscode/test/smoke/test_data/vscode-smoketest-express @master[1⇡] ?' == 'test'
      + expected - actual

      -~/dev/Microsoft/vscode/test/smoke/test_data/vscode-smoketest-express @master[1⇡] ?
      +test
      
      at Context.<anonymous> (out/tests/integrated-terminal.js:46:24)
      at next (native)
      at fulfilled (out/tests/integrated-terminal.js:8:58)
      at process._tickDomainCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:135:7)
```

This is my `$PS1`:

```
\n\[\033[01;34m\]\w\[\033[00m\]$(__git_prompt)\033[0m\n\[\033[1;31m\]❯ \[\033[0m\]
```

I'm assuming it's failing due to the `\n` at the start.

data.title: Can't collapse code in large file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0-insider
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Checkout [TypeScript](https://github.com/microsoft/typescript)
2. Navigate to `checker.ts`.
3. Collapse all.
4. Navigate to `function propertiesRelatedTo` and uncollapse.
5. Uncollapse the `for` loop. The *entire* body is uncollapsed! Nothing inside can not be collapsed.
6. The problem is solved if you delete a bunch of other functions in the file, so it appears to only happen in large files.

data.title: Should editor.letterSpacing affect the EOL selection too?
data.body:
#27487

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26596612/3333da1c-4524-11e7-9139-530f534fefbd.png)

Notice the end of line selection isn't affected by `editor.letterSpacing`:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26596627/3caf9b58-4524-11e7-8751-a96f82ad71ef.png)

data.title: Wide characters should apply editor.letterSpacing twice
data.body:
#27487 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26596351/4cf2b294-4523-11e7-8ff8-db0857e07dd3.png)

They should still be aligned here:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/26596386/6375d906-4523-11e7-8f5d-54dc75745d82.png)

data.title: Breakpoints/Call Stack: clicking on entry with column info should jump to that column
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. have some column breakpoints in one line
1. click on them from the breakpoints view

=> you do not end up in the column of the breakpoint

data.title: Hide deprecation messages when debugging node 8 with inspector protocol

These were added late before the Node 8 release:

data.title: Could not install typings files for JavaScript language features.
data.body:
@rebornix

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.13.0-insider (afe47dc84467b487ce0079ff72f55e7ef4f7ebca, 2017-05-30T09:59:32.734Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.16199
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|npm-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.3.0|
|angular2-snippets|danwahlin|1.0.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.9|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. 安装最新版本的vscode
2. 提示（如图）：Could not install typings files for JavaScript language features. Please ensure that NPM is installed and is in your PATH
Warning: Could not install typings files for JavaScript language features. Please ensure that NPM is installed and is in your PATH (occurred again)
Tweet us your feedback.
How was your experience?
Other ways to contact us
Submit a bug
Request a missing feature
Tell us why?(130 characters left)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13050025/26594271/944cc460-4599-11e7-8e17-9517905432f8.png)

data.title: Git askpass trigger windows firewall warning?
data.body: Since the April release you get a firewall warning when starting VS Code and I believe `askpass` is responsible for this: [http.createServer((req, res) ...](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/extensions/git/src/askpass.ts#L19)
